title: Lidl ramps up attack on Big Four supermarkets with plans for online grocery service
text:
German discounter Lidl is preparing to launch an online delivery service as early as next year.

The supermarket chain, which has more than 760 stores in the UK, said the service would not be a direct replication of its online operations in other countries.

Lidl already offers an online service in a string of European countries where customers can purchase items such as alcohol and general merchandise products including clothing, children's toys and DIY tools for delivery.

Speaking at a conference in London this week, Lidl’s UK digital director Alex Murray said: “You can’t take a model you have elsewhere, and just drop that into the UK and hope that works. That’s not a good idea.”

Just this...
description: German discounter Lidl is preparing to launch an online delivery service as early as next year.
